name: Vulture
description: The Vulture is a powerhouse of a fighter, equipped with two large hardpoints and exceptional agility. It punches well above its weight class in combat zones and bounty hunting.

name: Mamba
description: The Mamba is an ultra-fast combat ship with high burst damage potential. Designed for hit-and-run tactics, it excels at chasing down fleeing targets.

name: Fer-de-Lance
description: Combining luxury with lethality, the Fer-de-Lance is a favorite among PvP pilots. With one huge hardpoint and excellent speed, it’s a duelist’s dream.

name: Krait Mk II
description: The Krait Mk II is a balanced combat ship with a strong hardpoint layout, fighter bay, and cargo space. A top-tier choice for mission running, bounty hunting, and CZs.

name: Alliance Chieftain
description: The Alliance Chieftain is a hull-tank bruiser. Built to stay in the fight, it performs best under fire and thrives in close-quarters brawls.

name: Alliance Challenger
description: The Challenger is a slightly less nimble but tougher version of the Chieftain, offering improved internals and defensive capabilities.

name: Alliance Crusader
description: The Crusader sacrifices some firepower for a fighter bay, making it ideal for wing support and multi-crew combat.

name: Python Mk II
description: The Python Mk II is a combat-tuned variant of the original Python. It trades cargo space and versatility for better armor, improved hardpoint placement, and enhanced cooling.

name: Diamondback Scout
description: The Diamondback Scout is an entry-level explorer with excellent heat efficiency and strong maneuverability. It’s a budget ship often used for high-risk recon or long-range scans.

name: Diamondback Explorer
description: A fan-favorite exploration vessel, the DBX boasts excellent jump range and rugged durability. It's a top choice for Guardian site runs and solo expeditions into the black.

name: Asp Scout
description: The Asp Scout is the lesser sibling of the Explorer variant, often criticized for its underwhelming performance. However, it's still used by budget-conscious Commanders.

name: Asp Explorer
description: A legendary exploration ship, the Asp Explorer is known for its massive jump range, strong hull, and multi-role potential. It’s been used in most major galaxy-wide expeditions.

name: Krait Phantom
description: A stripped-down version of the Krait Mk II, the Phantom sacrifices firepower for speed, jump range, and internal room—making it an ideal deep-space vessel.
weaknesses: Weaker shields than Krait Mk II

name: Mandalay
description: The Mandalay is Lakon's next-gen explorer, intended to replace the Asp Scout with better jump range, improved cockpit visibility, and a rebalanced internal layout.
strengths: Optimized for scanners and long expeditions

name: Imperial Eagle
description: A sleeker, faster variant of the Core Dynamics Eagle, the Imperial Eagle offers improved speed and shielding, though at a slightly higher cost. It's a favorite among new Empire-aligned combat pilots.
strengths: Better shielded than Eagle Mk II

name: Imperial Courier
description: The Imperial Courier is a fast, shield-heavy interceptor ideal for hit-and-run tactics. With excellent cockpit visibility and aesthetics, it's a go-to for solo pilots looking for a stylish edge.

name: Imperial Clipper
description: The Imperial Clipper combines luxury and capability. With high speed, a large cargo hold, and reasonable firepower, it's used for fast trading, piracy, and elegant bounty hunting.
strengths: Very fast for a large ship

name: Imperial Cutter
description: The Imperial Cutter is a behemoth of luxury and power. With the highest shield potential of any ship, it’s perfect for bulk trading, piracy, and high-level combat support—if you can fly it.

name: Federal Dropship
description: Originally designed for troop transport, the Dropship is a heavily armored, hard-hitting vessel that's ideal for surface operations and combat missions.

name: Federal Assault Ship
description: Built for offensive pressure, the FAS is one of the hardest-hitting medium ships. It's fast, tanky, and well-suited to both PvP and PvE combat.

name: Federal Gunship
description: Designed to control space through volume of fire, the Federal Gunship supports multiple turret hardpoints and a fighter bay. It’s a battlefield anchor in conflict zones.

name: Federal Corvette
description: The Federation’s ultimate warship, the Corvette mounts two huge hardpoints, thick armor, and powerful shields. It’s a boss killer—but you'll need the rank to command it.

name: Type-9 Heavy
description: The Type-9 Heavy is the definitive space truck. It features massive cargo capacity and is a staple in the cargo hauling and mining support scenes.

name: Type-10 Defender
description: A modified combat version of the Type-9, the Type-10 Defender is designed to absorb and return fire in Thargoid encounters and high-threat CZs.

name: Anaconda
description: The Anaconda is one of the most iconic ships in the galaxy. Capable of nearly every role, it boasts incredible jump range, massive internal space, and serious firepower.

name: Beluga Liner
description: The Beluga is the premier luxury vessel, catering to the elite. Though spacious and elegant, it requires careful piloting and internal rework to shine.

name: Type-6 Transporter
description: A dependable trader, the Type-6 offers good cargo capacity at a low price. It's a great choice for newer pilots looking to scale up their cargo runs.

name: Type-7 Transporter
description: The Type-7 is a dedicated cargo hauler designed for maximum transport capacity on a medium pad. It's commonly used for mining support and mid-level trading.

name: Type-8 Transporter
description: The Type-8 is the spiritual successor to the Type-7, offering better internals, stronger defensive capability, and a fighter bay. It's ideal for bulk transport in dangerous regions.

name: Keelback
description: A hybrid trader with access to a fighter bay, the Keelback is used for mining, support roles, and light transport missions. Its flexibility makes it a favorite among mission runners.
strengths: Fighter bay on a medium pad

name: Python
description: The Python is a medium-padded juggernaut—capable of combat, trading, mining, or exploration. It's often regarded as the best all-rounder in the galaxy.
strengths: Huge cargo potential on medium pads

name: Orca
description: The Orca is a stylish Saud Kruger passenger liner used for sightseeing and luxury tours. It’s sleek, fast, and easily modded for exploration or stealth transport.

name: Dolphin
description: The Dolphin is the smallest of the Saud Kruger luxury vessels. Often used for light passenger runs, it's also a surprising favorite among explorers for its heat efficiency.

name: Sidewinder Mk I
description: The Sidewinder Mk I is the default starter ship provided to all new pilots. While lightly armed and fragile, it is agile and cost-effective, perfect for training and short-range missions.

name: Eagle Mk II
description: The Eagle Mk II is a fast and nimble ship often used for combat training and bounty hunting. While fragile, its maneuverability is unmatched among small ships.

name: Hauler
description: The Hauler is an early-game cargo ship with excellent jump range and low cost. It can also be outfitted as an inexpensive explorer.

name: Adder
description: The Adder is a balanced multipurpose ship capable of light combat, trading, and short-range exploration. It's a solid step up from the Hauler or Sidewinder.

name: Viper Mk III
description: The Viper Mk III is a nimble and affordable combat ship, ideal for bounty hunting and interdictions. Its iconic profile and speed make it a staple in security fleets.

name: Viper Mk IV
description: The Viper Mk IV trades some of the Mk III’s speed for more armor and module slots. It’s a rugged brawler that can take hits while delivering steady firepower.

name: Cobra Mk III
description: The legendary Cobra Mk III is one of the most versatile and iconic ships in the galaxy. It's fast, agile, and capable of taking on almost any role with the right outfitting.

name: Cobra Mk IV
description: The Cobra Mk IV is a more armored version of the Cobra Mk III with additional internals. However, its sluggish maneuverability makes it less favored in combat.

name: Cobra Mk V
description: The Cobra Mk V builds on the legendary legacy of the Cobra series with improved heat management, hardpoint placement, and better loadout flexibility.
